reuze

Class gb_Origin3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuze.gb_Origin3D

  • public class gb_Origin3D
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines an origin and set of axis vectors for a 3D cartesian coordinate system.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      gb_Vector3 origin 
      gb_Vector3 xAxis 
      gb_Vector3 yAxis 
      gb_Vector3 zAxis 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      gb_Origin3D()
      Creates a new origin at the world origin using the standard XYZ axes
      gb_Origin3D(float x, float y, float z) 
      gb_Origin3D(gb_Vector3 o)
      Creates a new origin at the given origin using the standard XYZ axes
      gb_Origin3D(gb_Vector3 o, gb_Vector3 dir)
      Attempts to create a cartesian coordinate system with the given point as its origin and the direction as its Z-axis.
      gb_Origin3D(gb_Vector3 o, gb_Vector3 x, gb_Vector3 y) 
      gb_Origin3D(m_Matrix4 mat) 

    • Method Summary

      • gb_Origin3D

        public gb_Origin3D(gb_Vector3 o)
        Creates a new origin at the given origin using the standard XYZ axes
        Parameters:
        o - origin

      • gb_Origin3D

        public gb_Origin3D(gb_Vector3 o,
           gb_Vector3 dir)
        Attempts to create a cartesian coordinate system with the given point as its origin and the direction as its Z-axis. In cases when two of the direction vector components are equal, the constructor will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        o - origin of the coordinate system
        dir - z-axis

      • gb_Origin3D

        public gb_Origin3D(gb_Vector3 o,
           gb_Vector3 x,
           gb_Vector3 y)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        o - origin of the coordinate system
        x - x-direction of the coordinate system
        y - y-direction of the coordinate system
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x and y vectors are not orthogonal
